page.title: 06HODGE HILL NURSERY.
page.content: One of the oldest nurseries in the area,Hodge Hill,has occupied its present site for over 65 years. Covering an area of 10 acres,three of them under glass,{plants and {vegetables}are produced for wholesale markets in Birmingham & Wolverhampton. Kidney beans,broad beans,lettuce,Dahlias and Sweet Williams are grown outside while the main crop inside is chrysanthemums, 400,000 annually,as well as 8,000 boxes of bedding plants. Originally walled greenhouses 16 feet high were used to grow large ferns but these wooden framed buildings were completely destroyed by severe gales in January 1956. Still on site is a 100 year old steam engine used for steam sterilising the greenhouses during Winter months.
